channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report X-2024061572
item.description:
Report X-2024061572

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-02T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: PINE BLUFF
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Found by the FRA Hazmat with a leaking secondary closure plug. Upon inspection, the bottom outlet valve was found to be in the fully open position, even though the valve handle was closed and sealed. The valve operating stem had a sheared pin which did not close the valve. A pin was installed, the valve closed, and the plug properly secured. Eight of eight manway swing bolts were also less than tool tight and properly secured.

item.title: Report X-2024061580
item.description:
Report X-2024061580

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-02T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: PINE BLUFF
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Found with by the FRA with a strong odor and all the manway swing bolts in the down position. Upon arrival, UP HMM properly secured the bolts and the odor dissipated and no further evidence of a release. All other fittings and devices were properly secured

item.description:
Report X-2024061452

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: NORTH LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: X-2024061452: Roll-off type container with plastic liner. Liner failed allowing liquid from the waste to leak out of the container's rear hatch. Absorbents used to solidify liquid and rear hatch tightened/secured. Full waste manifest...002208346VES X-2024061453: Roll-off type container with plastic liner. Liner failed allowing liquid from the waste to leak out of the container's rear hatch. Absorbents used to solidify liquid and rear hatch tightened/secured. Full waste manifest... 002208347VES
